thread.title: USC fires head coach as history of boozing emerges
thread.title_full: USC fires head coach as history of boozing emerges | New York Post

author: Brian Lewis
title: USC fires head coach as history of boozing emerges
text:
While CC Sabathia’s enrollment in alcohol rehab stunned many observers around the Yankees, it appears USC coach Steve Sarkisian’s drinking took few by surprise, well-known back to his days at Washington.
After Sarkisian was deemed “not healthy” and put on indefinite leave Sunday , the school announced his firing Monday as Sarkisian seeks treatment for his issues.
“After careful consideration of what is in the best interest of the university and our student-athletes, I have made the decision to terminate Steve Sarkisian, effective immediately,” athletic director Pat Haden said in a statement. “Through all of this we remain concerned for Steve and hope that it will give him the opportunity to focus on his personal well being.”
The 41-year-old Pete Carroll disciple was under the influence of alcohol at a USC event in August, slurring his words and cursing. Trojans players said Sarkisian “didn’t seem right” during a recent meeting, and others close to the program said he was unstable during a Sept. 26 win at Arizona State.
That fits the picture being painted of his days at Washington. Despite never having been publicly disciplined by Washington, his use of alcohol was an issue during his five seasons coaching the Huskies , according to the Los Angeles Times. After the August incident, some ex-players implied it was just par for the course.
Sarkisian after USC lost to Washington last week Photo: Getty Images “Coach Sark is still having fun at USC!” ex-Washington tight end Michael Hartvigson tweeted, with the hashtag #ThingsHaventChanged.
“I would’ve made him run the stadium carrying a 6 pack since he wanna drink so much lol,” tweeted former Washington defensive lineman Danny Shelton (now on the Cleveland Browns), adding a sarcastic #shocked hashtag. In response, linebacker Shaq Thompson tweeted an emoji laughing and shedding tears.
One player told the LA Times that in Sarkisian’s debut season at Washington, he sometimes showed up to early-morning meetings “smelling like booze and (with) eyes all red, like he’s been on a bender.”
Two others said Sarkisian and other assistants regularly drank in the offices. One player said the coach often kept an 18-pack of Coors Light by his desk and was unusually loud and unsteady on some team flights.
Offensive coordinator Clay Helton is serving as USC’s interim coach. The Trojans play Saturday at Notre Dame.
